They were even happy to help with getting ice for a hurt foot or allowing my phone to charge at reception. If you need to know any information about Barcelona, then they were able to answer any question and provide recommendations. The hotel serves a buffet breakfast for €10 pp, it is more of a continental breakfast than a fry up though. However we found it more than adequate. The hotel is located a bit far out and it did take a while for us to get to and from the hotel. I think next time we would stay nearer the central part of town. The area is more of a business area then touristy. However it was very quiet. The room was a bit stuffy and I think the air con could have worked better, but there were plenty of windows to open and no noise from outside. There is a very good shopping centre about 5 min walk from the hotel and it has a wide selection of resturants and shops including Mango and Zara. I think this hotel is aimed at the business travel but I would not have a problem recommending this hotel to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a little out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: nodmans
Reviews.Content: After reading the views on Trip Advisor and other sites, I was a little wary when booking the Vincci Condal Mar. Its a great hotel, just a short walk to the metro Station. We went Friday - Monday and on saturday it wasnt a problem getting back to the hotel as the metro runs all night. Only criticism is the pool doesn't open in April. Paul

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel close to the convention center”
Reviews.Author: Rob77Milan
Reviews.Content: this hotel is ok if you have to go to the barcelona convention center. It's very close, you can reach the center by foot in ten minutes. you can easly reach the city center by metro or by taxi. the rooms are clean and big and the reception personal is very kind. I advice this hotel if expecially if you are on a business trip

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, would go back again!”
Reviews.Author: lottiehalli
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was lovely, very clean and comfortable. very stylish too.The Room was very contempory and the bathroom was really nice too. The main reason why I am leaving a review is because of the location. When I read all the reviews before I went I was very worried about how far away it was, However it was a 8 minute walk to the Metro (Selva Del Mar) Which took you right into the centre or anywhere you wanted to go. A Three day pass for the metro which also included busses trains and trams cost 15 euro's this also included to and from the airport by train and metro. I purchased this ticket from the information desk at arrivals in Barcelona airport. The area around the hotel is more of a business and residential area. so nice and quiet, lovely if you want to get some sleep after a long day or night, sightseeing or partying! The staff at the hotel were very friendly, and helpful. I would definately go again to this hotel. thumbs up from me.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, but Stands Alone in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: GT05
Reviews.Content: My mate and I (both in our early 20's) stayed here in January of ’09, on our seventh stop on a round the world trip. We found the Vincci Condal Mar to be an upscale hotel, with elegant new rooms, good staff, but in not such a good location. We stayed in a standard double room, which included two double beds, a work desk, a bar fridge, a couple of cupboards, a widescreen TV, an air conditioner and heater, an in room safe and a stylish new bathroom including a toilet, a bidet, sink and bath/shower. The room was pretty luxurious and had the little extras (eg. bath gel, shower caps, etc) that you would hope for in a stylish hotel. The room was very comfortable and clean. The shower was easily controlled in terms of temperature and had good water pressure. The hotel does offer a mini bar, internet and in-room movies, but all were rather expensive. My traveling companion visited the gym during our stay and reported that it was simply a couple of treadmills predominately. The roof included an outdoor pool and some good views. Unfortunately, the pool was closed during our stay, after all it was winter. Sitting by the pool having a look at the view and hearing the water crash from the beach would probably be rather refreshing on a hot summer’s day, but I don’t know that for sure. In terms of location, my mate and I were trying to decide between this hotel and the Vincci Maritimo Barcelona hotel which is part of the Vincci chain. We chose this hotel as it had the fitness center which my traveling companion wanted. Honestly, during winter especially, I would have preferred to stay at the Maritimo Barcelona as it was a 1 minute walk from the Selva De Mar train station and just over the road from the Diagonal Mar shopping center. The Vincci Condal Mar is further north, away from the beach area, and is about a 5 to 10 minute walk from the nearest train station, Selva De Mar, and about the same from the shopping center. This made the Vincci Condal Mar stand out in terms of its location. It really is just planted in almost a no mans zone, near nothing much. It is also about a 20 euro cab ride from the Estacio de Franca train station (one of the international train stations). In terms of time it takes to get into the city via train, from my memory, it’s not the 30 minutes that some people are reporting. Much closer to 15 or even 10 minutes. The restaurant or bar at the hotel appeared rather expensive, and so we never ate or had a drink at the hotel. Instead we had a couple of meals at the Diagonal Mar food court area where you can find different cuisines to suit your tastes. The other annoyance we had with the hotel was the fact that after asking for separate double beds, we got to our room to find two double beds pushed up against one another. Now, being two guys, it’s not the most comfortable thing having to sleep in such a close proximity to one another. But this again, was simply an annoyance and I’m sure we could have separated the beds a little if we could have been bothered. We booked this hotel through Expedia which offered a very decent rate. I’ve attached a couple of pictures, hopefully helping those unsure of whether to stay here or not. The hotel was very comfortable and had nice views and decent staff members. Unfortunately, the location really lets the hotel down, and so I’d definitely try to book into the Vincci Maritimo Barcelona hotel over this hotel, for convenience purposes. If I couldn’t get a room at the Maritimo, then I’d be happy enough to stay once again, at the trendy Vincci Condal Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Set Your Expectations Right”
Reviews.Author: DawnCK
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a modern, aesthetically interesting building. Throughout our 4-night stay there, we are of the impression that the management of this property are doing what they need to do to maintain the bare essentials of the building. However, although it is a relatively new building, it is already showing signs of some wear with apparently no attempt to fix issues whilst they are still easily repaired. For example, the seating in the lobby looked worn, one wall in our room was soiled, lamps looked tired. The place essentially looked unloved. We also felt that the staff, whilst professional and efficient, were not hospitable. They did not do anything to make guests feel welcomed -- everyone was polite but rather impersonal. This hotel would appear to cater to business travellers who would have no compunction with travelling by taxi to and from the hotel. It is, otherwise, a 5- to 10-minute walk to the nearest Metro or tram station. It is not that bad but leisure tourists would probably find this a rather inconvenient place to lodge. On the plus side, the staff were efficient. On our second night, we discovered that there was a problem with the plumbing -- there was no cold (?!) water. When we informed the front desk, we were told that there were problems on our floor and promptly provided another room. Then again, I guess, they should have informed us of the problem since they were already aware rather than have me find out when I was already stripped and bare in the shower. Because it is located in an industrial area of the city, the hotel was also quiet and we were unmolested by noise, hustle and bustle. Not an unpleasant stay in all, certainly helped to no end with the fact that we had booked the room at a ridiculous rate through lastminute.com. Don't expect the world from this hotel and you will walk away surprised by how pleasant the stay actually was.

Reviews.Title: “walk on”
Reviews.Author: iangoalfar
Reviews.Content: very modern hotel with comfottable rooms. directions to the hotel could have been clearer . if u like walking then its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and a nice area despite some other comments”
Reviews.Author: maffyoo
Reviews.Content: I'm sure most people reading the other reviews and looking at any aerial shots of the location of the vincci condal mar may be a bit concerned about its location. all i can say is that its actually not bad at all when you get there... a block toward the diagonal mar from the hotel is a demolished building it isnt too bad though, and the streets are clean and generally quiet. I stayed at the condal mar whilst attending a conference and walked everywhere, including late night/ early evening walks between the hotel and the diagonal mar, as well as towards Avinguda diagonal. Generally i found it very quiet, i was quite surprised by how many families and people walking there dogs there were in the area. A dog is clearly the pet of choice in this part of Spain. Generall the hotel was great, with one exception. Im sure most Brits will be a slightly perturbed that there aren't tea or coffee making facilities in any of the rooms. the rooms themselves are very tidy and extremely nice if you like something more modern. the atrium of the hotel is worth seeing, as is a trip up to the top floor where there is a bar area (used in the summer i assume) and a swimming pool (also used in the summer i assume) the views are great. Generally i was very happy. unfortunately i didnt have time to travel into the city due to the long days at conference, but the diagonal mar has plenty of places to eat and most were reasonably priced and the food excellent. This leads to my only gripes about the Condal mar. 1. The japanese 'fusion' restaurant is VERY expensive for what you get. the food was good but there was very little. i had three courses (max available) and was still hungry 2. The bar area in the reception area, the private-ish seating is great but the service was absolutely terrible, many times myself and colleagues simply paid rather than order more drinks, we also noticed that quite a few locals came in had a drink and then walked off without paying. They really dont seem to be on the ball with that one on reception. If you stay and find it hard to get any service, go to reception, they seemed to be able to get hold of the barman wherever he was

Reviews.Title: “Nice but off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: NeanderthalBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in October. It was a last minute trip and I didn't really have much of a choice in hotels. This is a really modern looking hotel from the outside and this continues inside. The room we had booked was pretty small and we were disappointed with the lack of tea/coffee making facilities or an iron in the room. The staff in general were very friendly efficient and helpful. Any problems we encountered were dealt with quickly and politely. The pool unfortunately was closed for the duration of our visit which was disappointing but we later found out that this always happens for the winter months. The gym is small but adequete. The hotel is about a 15 minute (brisk) walk from the beaches and 7 or 8 from the nearest metro and tram lines which service all the major tourist sites in the city with a change or two. Overall the hotel is probably aimed more at business travellers than tourists and is a bit too much off the beaten track

Reviews.Title: “would go again”
Reviews.Author: PaulaPratt
Reviews.Content: A lot of people have written about the 15 min walk to the metro all i can say is they must walk really slow the Hotel staff suppied a map and directions to the Metro it took us 3 min to walk there ,jump on the yellow line and 3 stops and you are in the city centre. the area does look run down but this seems to be the norm in the outskirts i loved the Hotel and we never felt unsafe walking back at night.The rooms are very modern and room service was good and not a rip off i cant wait to go back to Barcelona and this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lower than expectations”
Reviews.Author: Mariagreece8
Reviews.Content: We went with my husband to Barcelona and stayed at Vincci Condal Mar Hotel for 6 nights. I had read the comments about the area on your sight and i have to admit I was rather scared. The hotel is situated far from the city center in an industrial area. The metro station was rather far (15 minutes of walking in a dodgy area). We arrived on Saturday and everything was closed, so the area seemed even worse. The trade center DIAGONAL MAR is not far, but you have to go through an isolated part of the city that seems dangerous. The hotel was rather clean but the staff was inpolite and the breakfast was average. Overall I would not stay at that hotel if I visit Barcelona again, not because of the distance but because of the area. There are other hotels situated on the Diagonal Mar at the same price that offer better accessibility to the metro and bus stations.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, Great ambience”
Reviews.Author: jonkburrage
Reviews.Content: What can I say! Some people complain about the walk from the city being a bit far...my partner and I did this trip on a shoestring, really, £0.04 for return flights from newquay, uk to barcelona with ryanair (thats for both of us) and then we got this hotel for £40 for a night on lastminute.com. Saw people complaining about the walk but we enjoyed a leaisurely, if prolonged walk along the waterfront at night with our luggage to get to the hotel, it took 45 mins of so but we were ambling. It was worth it. The hotel is in a stunning location just off the eastern end of diagonal mar near the shopping centre and beach. Its a modern marvel, feels like somthing from thunderbirds! The rooms are great, spacious, the bed was incredibly comfortable, the service was top notch and the price was unbeatable....what can I say, I want to go back now!!!

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: S_G_Taylor
Reviews.Content: They made dreadful mistakes with our booking - a good job we phoned them before we arrived - they only had us down for 1 night rather than the 3 that had been paid for. OK looking hotel, modern rooms but very poor quality. Not at all practical and there was a glass sliding door (that had come out of its runners so just hung there and banged when you moved it) between the bedroom and the toilet. Everything else was just about OK. Because of the modern rotunda style of the hotel the bedroom windows were definitely not designed to look out of. They were extremely narrow and poky. Location just about OK. Wouldn't want to be walking around there late at night though. Use a cab. The package we had included F1 Grand Prix tickets and coach transfers. The hotel denied all knowledge of this and from that point on just lied to us. Once we proved the booking they told us they would be getting the tickets but that there was no coach transfer. We were then told to just turn up at the racetrack with our voucher (that would have been fun!!!) and they would let us in (no they wouldn't have and we would have spent over an hour and a half getting to the track). As the whole thing had been booked by El Corte Ingles department store, we decided to go there and they sorted it out. It became extremely apparent that if front of desk and the administrators behind the scenes don't know the answer to something, they just make it up. The tickets were at a sister hotel and there was a coach coming but they just didn't know about it. A very stressful time and a waste of one of our precious days trying to sort it out. Even without this problem the front of house are awkward and obstructive. Very poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel for a fantastic price”
Reviews.Author: twiggyholly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night at the beginning of April. Alot of the other reviews say it is in a bad area, but I really didn't see that! It is literally 100m away from a very nice redeveloped area, and less than a 10min walk to the beach. Me and my partner arrived late in Barcelona, and decided to walk to the hotel from the bus station in order to get our barings. It is quite a long walk (50mins roughly), but a really great thing to do in order to see some sights that the tourists dont usually see. When we arrived, check in was quick and painless, and the room was really really nice. Fantastic modern design with all the little extras you could want. In order to get around barcelona, me and my partner opted for the bus turistic. It has a stop not too far from the hotel and goes virtually everywhere. Well worth it for a short visit. I wish I had spent longer at this hotel. I also wish I had been there in may when the swimming pool on the roof is open. Overall, this is a fantastic hotel for the price (we paid £47 for the room) Dont be put off by the distance from the centre, there are many many transport options.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...Tough to find...”
Reviews.Author: BrendanVancouver
Reviews.Content: Overall it was not a bad experience. I will admit that I spent 20 hours flying and then arriving in Barcelona late at night just o catch the last train to the city centre and then cabbing it from there. The cab ride did cost about 20 Euros but I was hot, tired and sweaty and would have paid twice that. Even the cab driver had a bit of difficulty finding the hotel. Arrived thankfully just before a tour bus and after a little trouble at the front desk with my reservation was up to my room. The rooms have a truly modern design, if you look very closely the wormanship does leave a little to be desired but nothing ghastly. I stayed for 3 nights and received a good deal through a website. Had a nice room on the lower floor, spacious and clean. I have read the other reviews of the neighborhood being dodgy, it is not overly bad. If you are a female travelling alone maybe it would be questionable but as a late 20's male by myself I never felt unsafe. The rooftop pool is pretty amazing and busy during the day as well. I had breakfast in the restaurant all three mornings and if you are looking for the typical amercian breakfast this is not for you. Very European with cold meats and cheese's and different breads with some hot items as well...personally I loved it! The walk to the city centre is a bit of a distance but not out of the questions, if you are a young group or couple it is a stylish hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: TheBigKoala
Reviews.Content: Appearances can be deceptive, this is a poor hotel. We should maybe have known things were not going to be good when the taxi driver told us that this hotel is just on the edge of a "very dodgy area", but being from London we are used to dodgy areas so this didn't phase us... We were first given a very substandard room, very dusty, bathroom door handle hanging off, light fittings not screwed in, chipped furnishings throughout... although we had booked through a travel website we were still paying a significant amount of money and so complained and were offered a new room (next door) which was the same style but of a significantly better quality, which led us to believe that the room we had was reserved for the particularly stupid... Apart from this, the hotel is FAR from the centre of Barcelona and you will be obliged to take public transport for at least quarter of an hour (after a ten minute walk) to get anywhere near where you would want to go... can you afford to be wasting a one-hour round trip of your precious holiday time? We thought we were being clever by saving a little money staying further out but the constant taxi fares of ten to an unbelieveable eighteen euros (if they felt like taking an unfeasably long route) add up. Five nights of these cabs took its toll on the pocket. The little piece de resistance for this hotel, apart from the fact that after asking for a late 2pm checkout we were called no less than five times after midday by the reception to remind us to get out, the maid thought it would be nice to steal five euro from us. I know, we should have put it in the safe but it was stolen just the same. I've stayed in some dodgy quarters in Barcelona but never knowingly had stuff stolen from me before but I guess there is always a first time. So, my advice would be, stay somewhere else. Stay central and save on cab fees. Ask yourself - why does this hotel have lots of rooms free in busy periods when the rest of Barcelona is jam packed?

Reviews.Title: “modern through and through”
Reviews.Author: ne-wanderingfree
Reviews.Content: Extremely attracted by low price and photographs of hotel. Drove down for a couple of nights from Southern France but didnt find the hotel easily. We were very lucky with the weather for early time of year. A bit concerned over appearance of area at first but the area seems to be enjoying regeneration and lets face it for prices like this for such a stunningly modern, new hotel a bit of road and path restructure can be accepted, at least there was free on street parking. The rooms were fabulous and faultless with attention to detail and quality fittings. The structure of the hotel was a bit daunting when you look over the central open area down to the ground floor, the rooms are on the outside of the round structure, but that adds to the thrill of the building. The view from the rooftop was fabulous across the city, even at night, but be careful out of season walking on the roof, as we walked enjoying the view we almost walked into the unlit open filled rooftop pool, could have been a great funny story, but probably unpleasant at the time. The only downside was the distance from the city centre, quiet a walk if you want to remain above ground and take in the sights. We didnt eat in the hotel so cant help out there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: GosiaLisbon
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel: very modern, very design. Maybe the design of the bathroom was a bit exaggerated as the door was kind of transparent and did not close properly. But apart from this yes, it is a nice hotel. It is not in the centre but not far from the metro station and in a few stations you are in Barrio Gotic. On the other side, if you came by car, you will have no problems parking on the street. Now.... the service was bad. There was this woman in the reception who was rude and who did not really make an effort to accomodate our requests as they should in a 4-star hotel. I got better service in 2-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Really mordern and fancy !!”
Reviews.Author: loubirmingham
Reviews.Content: Booked through octopus travel, loved this hotel, really good price for the hotel stay , would go back and back again, not in city but across the road is the tube station that gets you to all the site sin 5 mins anyway !!!! I loved it !!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!”
Reviews.Author: cant-wait-2-go-NYC
Reviews.Content: The location was shocking, we nick named it the Bronx! The staff were most unhelpful especially went my aunt had her purse stolen at the bar(broad day light)!The staff could hardly speak english and would not write a report about the inncident. The best thing about the hotel was the view from the roof , it was fantastic! All in all i would not stop at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Such a strange building”
Reviews.Author: svandenhoven
Reviews.Content: That was a pretty nice hotel, brand new (I'd say 2 years), with a nice view over Barcelona and the hills around. The pool on the roof was closed in February. Why not heating it ? Modern design inside, room was large, bathroom wall made of glass (you can see through, funny!) The only thing to complain about is the location, wich is a little bit out of the main places to visit (not that far from the subway station, and then a few stations from the centre). I won't recommend it for a single lady by night, the area was a hudge warehouse, and they are rebuilding it as residential. So, absolutely no night-life.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: chopper666
Reviews.Content: hotel was very nice - quite newly built with a very modern design. unusual or "modern" bathroom layout depending on your perspective. brown glass sliding door to bath/shower /toilet /bidet - whole wall made of glass. not exactly see through - but enough so you could see if some one was sitting on the loo. a distinct lack of privacy! wash hand basin out side of this glass area. had breakfast once - food was very good only problem was the staff - reception staff were very very slow to do anything - appeared disinterested in helping us / checking us in or out etc. no-one said hello / good bye as we entered or left hotel - even when we said it ourself. No rush at all - which can be very frustration when all you want to do is check in! a little isolated - easy taxi ride to port vell / olympic. i suggest the tourist bus - gets you to the main areas overall all i would stay there again , at a push, but would have a low expectation of reception!!

Reviews.Title: “Easily worth the extra travel!”
Reviews.Author: icecool16
Reviews.Content: When myself and my girlfriend were booking our trip to Barcelona this was the first hotel that caught my attention on Expedia. It seemed extremely attractive, both in terms of price and appearence and guess what; it is! The rooms are fantastically modern but not in the sense of them being overpoweringly 'whiter than white' and they provide all the comforts of a top class hotel. As students we wanted to stay in the nicest accomodation we could afford without frittering away our budget on what was basically a bed for the night. With the Vincci being a little outside of Barcelona it was the perfect dichotomy for us; cheap and 4-star! The area (as I remember being commented on before) is a little rough round the edges and I will admit to feeling a little threatend when we first stepped off the metro in the dead of night (my advise; metro by day, taxi by night; simply for piece of mind!) However despite this we were soon accosted by a friendly Catalan whose little English was even worse than my little Spanish but who still tried his best to give us directions to the hotel. We did, however, stil end up lost as the hotel is in the middle of surrounding building works and not easy to find in the dark! However, in the day it is an easy walk to the metro station and a short ride into town. By night the most expensive taxi we paid for was about 15euros - easily worth paying considering the saving on the hotel! The staff were excellent to us but then I attempted (as i do on every trip I've been on) to converse mainly in their language or at least to simply say 'hello' 'good-night' etc. I did observe a manager give a rather rude response and angry glare at a late-arriving Australian who announced himself with a 'g'day mate' but then my personal opinion is he was well within his rights to do much more than give him the evil eye! If you are the sort of person who expects staff in hotels in major cities to speak excellent English 100% of the time though and think this is part of what you pay for to stay in an unpmaket hotel then this is probably not the place for you! However this is the only gripe I would suggest you COULD have about the place. We did not eat the food but it looked fantastic. If money is no option to you then you may wish to stay in central Barcelona and forgoe the extra transport but then what's the point in that when you could stay in luxury, save some money and trade living on Orwell's doorstep with a simple, comfortable, cheap 10minute metro ride?! Highly recommended, I would certainly go back... provided some other Catalan is prepared to give me better directions!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modernista Style building in horrendous location!”
Reviews.Author: AlexRen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I picked The Vincci Condal Mar because of its close proximity to the Forum, where we would be attending the Primavera Sound Music Festival. We were quite impressed with the modern, modular look of the hotel from the pictures we saw on the website. And, I will admit, once we arrived at the Hotel, it was quite simply a marvel. Unfortunately, the hotel is located in a very industrial area, with a factory literally right across the street. We were told that it was located in an up and coming part of Barcelona, honestly though, there is nothing “coming up” in this part of Barcelona except for the thick clouds of smoke emanating from neighboring Factory’s chimneys. The Hotel is also about a fifteen minute, seven block walk from the nearest metro line. The hotel’s website states that it is 500 meters away from the metro line, that is an outright lie. On the bright side, the hotel rooms are very clean and also maintain that cylindrical shape of the hotel, which we thought was very neat. The staff is also courteous and helpful, if asked. It is probably one of the better hotels we have stated at this price range; it’s just a shame about the location. A taxi into the more picturesque parts of the city cost about 12 euros. If you are a tourist who plans to see the city, Barri Goti, Gaudi architecture, and Las Ramblas, you are better off staying closer towards the center of town. If you are a business traveler attending a conference in the Forum area, you are still better off finding a hotel closer to the Diagonal Mar Shopping area, as this hotel is nearly one mile away from the Forum area. Overall, the hotel is a wonderful architectural spectacle with good service, clean rooms and comfortable beds, but there is a reason why this hotel is so nicely priced. The Smog! The area is so miserable that it makes it hard to recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the Critics, our stay was brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: StarIreland
Reviews.Content: Before arriving at this hotel, I had my doubts after reading some reviews...The hotel is exactly as it shows on the website, amazing, stylish hotel with the staff being professionally pleasant all the time...The buffet breakfast is something to write home about as it was supurb, whatever took your fancy for breakfast, they had it! I will say it is a bit from the Ramblas but your on holidays! Order a taxi and within 5-10minutes your there with the worthed charge of €10. We extremely enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to friends and family!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, shame about the nieghbourhood...”
Reviews.Author: phaeochromocytoma
Reviews.Content: Once again, we were seduced by the website photos and didn't look too hard at the location. It's 20 minutes from downtown on the metro, then 10 minutes walk to the station through an industrial area (building sites, warehouses, vacant lots). No cafes or shops nearby. Hotel interior lovely with a very modern design and great rooms. Charges for wifi/ broadband are 15 euro per day - a con when other places in spain provide it free... Service at the hotel bar was a little erratic

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rtwtrip
Reviews.Content: I have to disagree with alot of the other reviews on the site as this hotel is a great find. Firstly, I got a real cheap rate which was the best deal in town. The hotel itself is brand new and has first class staff & service. They were really helpful. The hotel itself looks great. While a lot of people complain about the location but I think it one of its best features. Two blocks or so to the Metro or Tram in what is a SAFE area. Maybe a little quite at night but it by no means unsafe or anything to worry about. There is alot of construction going on within the immeidate area, so it going to get even better in a year or two. Glen

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fantastic, gypsie site 2 blocks away not so good”
Reviews.Author: samwho
Reviews.Content: The welcome my girlfriend and myself recieved was uncomfortable, the staff said very little and we not welcoming.. With exception, a young Brazillian man called Tiago a reception worker pretty much made the hotel experience enjoyable, easy going and he was approachable on helping us out to find places within the city and chatting with us whenever we passed by and very he was very polite , The room was amazing, the mini bar was used and when i came to pay the bill reception staff replied the mini bar was on them,which was very kind seeing through the fact the champayne was cracked open On route to the metro, our means of getting to the city was uncomfortable as there was a pikey camp site 2 minutes away from the hotel which was abit daunting as I was carrying the euro's I Couldnt wait to spend were in my pocket. the breakfast buffet was amazing and worth paying for as the selection and variety was amazing.. the shopping centre 2 mins down the road is great and has loads of resturants attached which i would advise are visited as the view is great. The hotel itself gets 9/10 but the construction site built up around it has affected my overall view of the hotel in more ways than one.

Reviews.Title: “terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ChrisZegers
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks new, but is put together very cheaply. Things start to fall apart already. The swimming pool is not heated and was absolutely freezing when I tried it, although the air temperature was a nice 25 degrees. The worst thing is the breakfast; an absolute joke. The coffee tasts like it was made a week ago and reheated 6 times. I will never go here again.

Reviews.Title: “A disgusting experience”
Reviews.Author: UKCityCouple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a terrible experience at this hotel. In the wardrobe in our room, one of the drawers had a large brown smeared mess in it which looked and smelt like someone had gone to the toilet in there! We were disgusted and appalled and called the manager on duty, Nicolas to the room. He looked at it, the head of cleaning came and removed the drawer and later replaced it cleaned. The manager said he would get back to me with how he was going deal with the problem. I expected an apology and some kind of compensation, however, he/the hotel took no responsibility. His response was that he didn’t know how it happened and he implied that we could have done it. Don’t stay at this hotel, it may look lovely and modern but this horrible experience and the insulting service attitude was the worst I’ve ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks but no thanks. Never returning again”
Reviews.Author: mlomagno
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights from Oct 10th thru Oct 12th. Hotel was easy to find since we know the area very well and have stayed at other hotels in the vicinity. First, there are people who claim that the hotel is far away from everything. Absolutely not true. They are very spoiled or do not know what they are talking about. The metro is a few minutes walk away as well as the tram. The Diagonal Mar shopping center is a few minutes walk too. True, the hotel is located in a quiet part of town which is going through a complete transformation but I would hardly call it unsafe. There were plenty of people living around the area in all directions. There are many businesses there too so the area is not filled with tons of people but the streets are clean, well light, and no danger present. Check in was fast and friendly. Hotel room was interesting. Despite it being a newish hotel, we noticed in our room many things that seemed to be a sign of poor workmanship. We noticed things peeling, parquet floors that were not measured and cut correctly. Too many signs of wear and tear for a new hotel. Also, not that I am a prude but I found the interior space poorly planned especially the bathroom walls. How can you have walls made of clear glass in the bathroom so that everyone else in the room can see you squatting on a toilet seat. No thank you! Room was clean and sufficient but nothing to rave about. Breakfast was mediocre. The head waitress, Bea was aloft and rude. She was too busy critiqing the other staff than analyzing how she operates. She asks us if we want coffee and then we have to wait several minutes because she was busy making some breakfast for someone in the back area. Several people who came in after us were served first. And it seemed that if you did not come in wearing a suit, you were not worthy of notice. We asked her two more times and each time showed indifference. The food was very bland. Nothing tasted decent. The eggs were water. The tortillas were void of taste. No real selection of fruits or yogurts. Overall, hotel was not horrible but I would search for a better deal elsewhere on expedia when I go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: PopPrincesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a couple of days in September and it was a lot better than we were expecting. It is modern and clean. For the price we paid, I think it was a fantastic deal. Breakfast was diversed and delicious. I would rather stay in a decent place than in one of the filthy and overpriced hotels in the centre. If you can't be bothered to walk to the tube station (it is a good ten minutes walk), a taxi will take you quickly to the centre for around 7 euros, which is not too bad. Print a map of the hotel area so you will never get lost.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location and service”
Reviews.Author: Girl_on_breaks
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is too far away from central barcelona. We booked it as it looked like a nice boutique hotel with a pool at a great price... but the cost and time to travel to port olimpic, plaza catalunya and las ramblas, for example, (10-15 euros in taxi, 20 euros to top of diagonal/tres torres area) made it expensive. It would have been better to pay slightly more for a room in a central hotel. Also if you get the hotel to book you a cab, there'll be a callout charge already on the clock of 1.55 to 4 euros. The surrounding area is underdeveloped, quiet, industrial and not a pleasant walk (10 mins or so) to the metro and tram - definitely not at night. There are people living in shacks on rooftops around and the general area doesn't feel secure. Also, we had a problem in our room and it was handled really badly and rudely by the staff and not resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davej1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Vincci Condal Mar , and I would have to say that we had a wonderful time , the rooms were excellent and staff were very helpful , the only area that was slightly disappointing was the wait at times at the hotel bar , but this was soon sorted by asking at the hotel reception and Lo and Behold someone would appear . For certain you would be able to get a hotel with this standard of accomodation in central Barcelona , but certainly not for the sort of price you pay for the Condal Mar . Likewise to get into seeing all the main sights it is just a 5- 10 minute walk to the Tram and Metro station ( and just 6.65e for a T10 ticket ) or use the Taxis which are very reasonable and can be ordered at reception , of which we never had to wait more than 5 minutes for . If I was to go back to Barcelona it would certainly be worth going back to this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: JessicaBerry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vincci Condal Mar from Saturday to Tuesday with my boyfriend. The hotel itself is good, modern, clean, with friendly staff and a good choice at breakfast. Unfortunately what lets the hotel down is its location. The area was extremely quiet and a bit of a ghost town. When we were walking to and from the metro station we felt quite vunerable as we were often the only people around. As a female I would not have liked to have been walking around on my own. We would probably not recommend the hotel to friends and family purely because of the location but otherwise it is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but bad location”
Reviews.Author: senhwei
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Vincci Condal Mar this weekend. First the good points : - very modern and nicely furnished and equipped boutique hotel - air-conditioned ! - LCD TV in the room - reasonable hotel rates - helpful staff - nice buffet breakfast (cost EUR14) Aspects which can improved - the room I had was on the small side though the bathroom was quite big - the rooftop terrace is very nice and offers a panoramic view of the city but the pool is too small Bad points - by far the Achilles heel of this hotel is its location. It's located away from the city center though there are subway stations nearby which makes the journey into the city a generally smooth. However, walking to and from the subway station, especially at night, can be quite a risky proposition. The general vicinity is a mixture of light commercial / industry and residential. But I did not feel safe walking around after dark and generally took a taxi back to the hotel instead of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Steer well clear”
Reviews.Author: sell
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to have to write this, but must warn other people attracted by the pictures on the website. Yes, the hotel is stunning, but the area it's in is little more than a slum, and very dangerous. The scary place with people living on the roof is still across the road. The hotels' security is also lax, although they were quick to pounce on us when we went for breakfast. Anyway, the real problem we had was the sneak thief who walked unchallenged into the breakfast room, and then walked out with my mother's handbag, which was on the floor between us. The thief (a woman pretending to be pregnant) then went outside and stole our car as well. While the staff, and particularly the manager, were as helpful as possible, the fact is you should be able to take your handbag with you to breakfast in a four-star hotel without all your belongings being nicked. My advice: steer clear, until the area really is redeveloped

Reviews.Title: “very dangerous location”
Reviews.Author: mr.g.taylor
Reviews.Content: although the hotel was comfortable, it was too remote, we was advised by people on this site to use the metro during the day and taxi by night. on our last night our taxi driver tried to mug us by pepper spraying and beating us and abandoned us five minutes from the hotel. we managed to get back to the hotel and asked for police assistance, the night manager was not interested and told us he was not helping because it didn't happen at the hotel. what sort of hotel does not give emergency assistance to their guest? i would recomend that you look for a safer location and don't put yourself at unnecessary risk. yours g. taylor

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, modern and great value”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELASCOT
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Vincci Condal Mar, as others have said it is well deisgned, modern and clean. The pool/sundeck area provides great views but it can get busy!!!. We found the staff very friendly and accomodating, please note that you can store your luggage after checkout for that later departure. The hotel is located near the Diagonal Mar shopping centre with lots of fashionable shops and a huge supermarket (ideal for drinks and snacks). We have stayed in the Diaganol Mar area before at the Princess and it is certainly an area that is developing fast both in terms of new hotels and apartment blocks. It is also part of the development of the coast stretching east of the Olympic port. It is now possible to walk, cycle, skate or whatever right along the new coastal boulevard. This is recommended particlularly in the evening as there are a large number of beach bars/restaurants each with their own DJ. Travelling in Barcelona is easy with the Metro (recommend using the El Maresme I Forum stop), bus (number 7) or the tram from Diaganal Mar. Things quieten down later at night in the hotel but thats probably a good thing for most people who have been busy exploring the may sights of this excellent city

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find!”
Reviews.Author: JimmyManchester
Reviews.Content: I came across this hotel by chance as I generally stay closer to the centre of Barcelona however from now on whenever I am in Barca I will be booking myself into this hotel. I found the hotel to be spotlessly clean, stylishly designed with comfortable living areas and fantastic bathrooms. The rooftop pool and stunning panoramic views of the city are excellent however bar service by the pool is poor (the only bad thing I could say about the hotel). The location as has been mentioned in other reviews is a little industrial however it is a short walk to the metro stop so you are minutes away from all of the main tourist areas. Personally I did not feel unsafe while walking around the area even late at night. Near to the hotel there is a large shopping area with many shops and restaurants, personally I prefer to see the older side of the town but some will love it. This is a great hotel for the money, I think it would suit couples and groups more than families but for the price I would recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not great”
Reviews.Author: orange_traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a lovely lobby and magnificent lights hanging from the ceiling, which gives an overall good first impression. The rooms are above average with a HUGE bed, nice TV and bathroom. The only downside is there is only one English channel - but still, not a big thing unless you are planning to stay in the room all day! The selection of room service is not great, and neither is the lunch-time option in the restaraunt, but the food you do get is excellent. The separate restaraunt "Takenmori" has amazing food, although quite expensive; about €80 for a meal for two! It is well worth it though. The bar in the lobby also shuts at 11 so we didn't even get a chance to try it! One major drawback is the size of the pool - absolutely tiny and not heated. The views from the roof are quite spectacular, especially at night, however, they do shut the terrace round about 10.30 - 11, so you don't get to see much of them. The staff at the hotel, although being far from rude and unhelpful, are quite unfriendly and speak very little english. Another big drawback is the location of the hotel, however it only costs round about €20-30 to / from the airport which is quite reasonable and about €10 into Las Ramblas. However, if you were staying in a city-centre hotel of the same quality i expect the prices would be a lot higher. Although the area is a little run-down, you feel quite safe walking around there - even at night. About a 10 minute walk away is a really good shopping centre with a massive supermarket and anything else you could possibly need. All in all, its ok, nothing special but definetely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Vincci Condal Mar for 6 nights in June 06. The Hotel is fine well kept and the Reception and Rooms modern Air conditioned and spotless, the Buffet breakfast was fine and offered a reasonable variety. That is the better parts of the review, the Hotel service is quite poor getting served at the rooftop Pool (which is mobbed if more than ten people are at it ) Bar is almost impossible as it gets staffed for about 5 mins every Hr, do not get fooled by the website claim of view the city by night as the rooftop gets shut just as darkness descends?. The area is largely made up of building yards/sites and what appears to be drab cheap maisonette style housing and areas of waste ground, travelling to city centre is not too bad and can be acheived by Tram, Metro or by taxi ( 12 - 15 Euro). Beware of short taxi rides IE from Metro stop to hotel as some drivers wont take the Hire if its not worth their while!!. There is absolutely nothing in the immediate area for a tourist however a 15 Min walk will take you to Diagonal Mar shoping Mall which has a really good array of eating and drinking establishments and some light entertainment EG 10 pin bowling. Overall the Hotel is probably worth going to as its price is quite attractive but the Hotel itself offers very little in the way of features or services, bear this in mind if you have plans for a night at the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night, 3rd June 2006. Arrived at 1pm and were promptly checked in. The room was very nice, on the second floor. Double bed, fabulous bath, flat screen tv. The best thing about this hotel was the breakfast, absolutely amazing, anything you could want was there. One not so great thing about the hotel was the location, however. It is about a five minute walk from the Selva de Mar metro station. No way to get into this station if you are in a wheelchair, just steep steps. There is a lot of construction work going on in the area. It is very quiet at night, the area is actually also very quiet, residential. The locals directed us to the hotel, very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic... Ideally located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went with Partner for 40th Birthday.... Although Hotel in an area of regeneration was lovely. The icing on the cake was the beautiful sun terrace, pool and views... About a five minute walk from the Selva de Mar metro but nothing too undaunting if lugging cases. The room itself is very comtemporary and had extremely comfortable beds... Service was excellent... Breakfast outstanding... Only a 10 minute walk from the beach or if you want to cheat catch the tram.. Can't wait to go back!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Take Care”
Reviews.Author: dsbsolihull
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 4 nights at this hotel and would like to warn those who read this site. The location is opposite a coffee warehouse and 100 yards from a Gypsy caravan site. The 'shopping centre' referred to as being close by is a sprawl of tenement blocks with occasional tapas bars and barricaded shops amongst them. The hotel is some way from a decent tourist area and seems to be there for mainly visiting businessmen to the local factories/warehouses. The nearest Metro is Selva de Mar on line 4 but for goodness sake don't use the Metro. In 16 hours I was mugged once and subject to a pickpocket theft on the Metro. The Police refused to listen to my reports unless I produced my passport thereby reducing any chance of the offenders being caught. It is apparent that such thefts are commonplace as I found out plain clothes police and security work the centre but there are no warnings to tourists on display in the Metro stations or on the trains. The hotel inself is OK and at most 3 star. The buffet breakfast was excellent. One problem was the shortage of HOT water, it was necessary to leave the taps running for 5-10 minutes before it got hot. The consierge will arrnage taxis to get around but seem to favour the Spanish speakers and yesterday, despite being told our taxi was next, 3 arrived and were given to Spaniards but after 30minutes I managed to flag a stray cab down. Another problem I encountered was taxi drivers never hearing of this hotel. Twice we were taken to a sister hotel, Maritimo, and the drivers were adament this was the only Vincci hotel in Barcerlona. One was extremely offensive and abusive that we dared suggest he was wrong. Take a card with your and write out the complete address. The rooms are modern but a poorly cleaned, just look at the dust on the black surfaces when you arrive, it will still be there when you leave. There is a minibar in the room, no tariff is displayed so don't be fooled into thiniing it is complimentary as they charge 1.6 euros for a small bottle of water. If you fancy a good night out and excellent food visit the area of Port Olympic where good seafood restaurants can provide large meals for about 40 Euros each with drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 5 day trip to Barcelona and stayed at this hotel, we all loved it. Yes, the location is slightly out of town, and the area is being developed, but it was a beautiful hotel and is excellent value for money. The staff were very pleasant and spoke english, breakfast was fine for a cold buffet and the rooms were spotless. If you like the minimalistic style and are looking for a modern and clean hotel but don't want the city centre price tag then I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Design at the Vincci.”
Reviews.Author: jazz_puppy
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a hotel. This is a beautifully designed hotel, where care and attention has been given to the design from the foyer, upwards. The circular design adds to an intriguing room design, but this doesn't mean the rooms are small by any standards. The room had all the mod cons you would want, except only one 1 English language TV channel (CNN), not that it really mattered to me, but it may to others. The breakfast was a feast, with plenty of variety all for 14 euros. The area outside the hotel was a bit strange as it was away from the hustle and bustle of the city, clearly in the old industrial zone of the city. The area was desolate, but was well lit and you always felt safe walking around in the early hours. The journey from the airport took about 35 mins in a taxi and cost in the region of 28 euros, which wasn't too bad. Alternatively you could take the Aerobus (from the Airport) to Placa Catalyuna and walk (5 mins) to Urquinaona on the L4 (yellow line) and then take the metro from there to Selva De Mar; (you can also take the metro to Catalyuna, but this will mean you need to change which means more walking if you have heavy bags). This will take you around 20-25 mins and will save you some money. The journey on the aerobus is only 3.75 euros and a metro journey single costs only 1 euro (so I'm told). It’s cheaper to get a T10 book which will give you 10 single journeys for around €7, which is what I did. Even though the hotel is not local, you can get into the centre of Barcelona in around 20-30 mins depending where you go. The bonus is that you do get to stay in a great hotel for less than a usual 4 star hotel in the city. The staff was polite and spoke great English and helped make my first time in Barcelona a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned form a trip from Barcelona and stayed in the Hotel Vincci Condal Mar. We'd recommend this hotel to our friends and family. It's pretty modern and it's nice that it's located just outside the crowdy centre of Barcelona. It takes you no longer than 5 minutes to get to Metro 'Selva de Mar'. (If it took you longer you must have been walking backwards...) The rooms are beautufully furnished, they're clean and breakfast is great. The view from the top op the hotel is amazing!! We enjoyed our stay in this hotel very much. Have fun in Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “Very mod,with cool bathroom door/wall”
Reviews.Author: PJHarkin
Reviews.Content: This Hotel Is certainly value for money.4 star,modern and a great buffet breakfast.the problem that some might have that the nearest metro(which runs every 5 mins)is ten minutes walk away with another 10-15 min ride into the city.the hotel is based in an industral area which means after 5.30pm its get very quiet and very weiry for walking alone.bottom line would I go back? most definitly

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: having read the reviews before hand i was also worried about my stay. this was totally unfounded. this was an excellent hotel. breakfast was wonderful, and plenty of it! yes it is a little far from the city, but the metro is only 10 mins away and we felt safe walking around at night. i would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to all. the only thing i would have liked was the pool, which was not in use. yes i went in march, but at 18 dgs, i would have liked a swim. but overall, a great little hotel & staff were great too.
